result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon R. Mason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked, the defendant has one credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Probation on Ct 3 in this same case, as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.
The defendant shall have no contact with Kimberly Zastrow or Kelly Mason of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way unless approved by the agent.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

timeConds.notes: Huber granted.  Defendant has 60 days to report.  Defendant may serve his sentence in Marathon or Taylor County.  Jail sentence is on Ct 2 only.

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Gordon R. Mason, appeared with Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant's Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee appeared. Defendant fails to appear, Attorney Caffee has no idea as to his whereabouts  A body only bench warrant was requested and granted on the defendants failure to appear. Case recalled, defendant had mistaken the date-warrant stands and preliminary hearing date will stand.

Pre-trial conference at 06-02-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 07-23-2015 08:20 am.
Preliminary hearing at 07-30-2015 08:30 am.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Gordon R. Mason, appeared with Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:20 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Gordon R. Mason appeared, pro se  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. Charges reviewed by Court.   Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Court admonished defendant to obtain counsel or the right to counsel may be forfeited.  Defendant will seek an attorney  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 09:20 am.
Initial appearance on March 19, 2015 at 09:40 am.

Defendant is not to possess or take any medications or drugs unless prescribed by a doctor and they are to be taken as prescribed.  The defendant shall submit to random urine testing if requested by law enforcement

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Initial appearance scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 09:40 am.
